name: ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration
comment: The child configuration that is used to run individual tests in an IFrame and post the results back to the parent. In principle this can run more than one test in the IFrame but currently only one is used.

stopTestOnExpectFailure.name: stopTestOnExpectFailure
stopTestOnExpectFailure.comment: If true (the default), then tests will stop after the first failed unittest/matcher.expect. If false, failed unittest/matcher.expects will not cause the test to stop (other exceptions will still terminate the test).

throwOnTestFailures.name: throwOnTestFailures
throwOnTestFailures.comment: If true (the default), throw an exception at the end if any tests failed.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: How long a unittest/unittest.TestCase can run before it is considered an error. A unittest/compact_vm_config.SimpleConfiguration.timeout value of null means that the limit is infinite.

onLogMessage.name: onLogMessage
onLogMessage.comment: Tests can call unittest/unittest.logMessage for diagnostic output. These log messages in turn get passed to this method, which adds a timestamp and posts them back to the parent window.

onStart.name: onStart
onStart.comment: Called as soon as the unittest framework starts running.

onSummary.name: onSummary
onSummary.comment:
Called with the result of all test cases. The default implementation prints the result summary using the built-in dart-core.print command. Browser tests commonly override this to reformat the output.

When unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.onSummary.uncaughtError is not null, it contains an error that occured outside of tests (e.g. setting up the test).

onTestResult.name: onTestResult
onTestResult.comment: Get the elapsed time for the test, and post the test result back to the parent window. If the test failed due to an exception the stack is posted back too (before the test result).

onTestStart.name: onTestStart
onTestStart.comment: Record the start time of the test.

autoStart.name: autoStart
autoStart.comment: If true, tests are started automatically. Otherwise unittest/unittest.runTests must be called explicitly after tests are set up.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

name.name: name
name.comment: Subclasses can override this with something useful for diagnostics. Particularly useful in cases where we have parent/child configurations such as layout tests.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

timeout.name: timeout
timeout.comment: How long a unittest/unittest.TestCase can run before it is considered an error. A unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.timeout value of null means that the limit is infinite.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.

onDone.name: onDone
onDone.comment: Called when the unittest framework is done running. unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.onDone.success indicates whether all tests passed successfully.

onExpectFailure.name: onExpectFailure
onExpectFailure.comment: Handles failures from expect(). The default in this base configuration is to throw an exception;

onInit.name: onInit
onInit.comment: Called as soon as the unittest framework becomes initialized. This is done even before tests are added to the test framework. It might be used to determine/debug errors that occur before the test harness starts executing. It is also used to tell the vm or browser that tests are going to be run asynchronously and that the process should wait until they are done.

onLogMessage.name: onLogMessage
onLogMessage.comment: Handles the logging of messages by a test case. The default in this base configuration is to call print();

onStart.name: onStart
onStart.comment: Called as soon as the unittest framework starts running.

onSummary.name: onSummary
onSummary.comment:
Called with the result of all test cases. The default implementation prints the result summary using the built-in dart-core.print command. Browser tests commonly override this to reformat the output.

When unittest/unittest_interactive_html_config.ChildInteractiveHtmlConfiguration.onSummary.uncaughtError is not null, it contains an error that occured outside of tests (e.g. setting up the test).

onTestResult.name: onTestResult
onTestResult.comment: Called when each test is first completed. Useful to show intermediate progress on a test suite. Derived classes should call this first before their own override code.

onTestResultChanged.name: onTestResultChanged
onTestResultChanged.comment: Called when an already completed test changes state. For example: a test that was marked as passing may later be marked as being in error because it still had callbacks being invoked.

onTestStart.name: onTestStart
onTestStart.comment: Called when each test starts. Useful to show intermediate progress on a test suite. Derived classes should call this first before their own override code.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
